content: On October 25, 1995, the Atlanta Braves celebrated their first World Series championship since relocating from Milwaukee in 1966. The Braves clinched the title by defeating the Cleveland Indians 1-0 in Game 6, with Tom Glavine delivering a masterful performance, pitching eight scoreless innings and earning the World Series MVP award. The victory marked a significant milestone for the franchise, solidifying their dominance in the 1990s and ending a 38-year championship drought.
